bibl.title: Letter from Emilie Lawrence Reed to [Jefferson Randolph Kean], May 10, 1938

div1.p: Reed informs [Kean] that she recollects her husband working with a microscope in the winter of 1890-91. She also expounds on the beauty of her garden. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Emilie Lawrence Reed to [Jefferson Randolph Kean], May 10, 1938
div1.opener:
From Mrs Walter Reed
Blue Ridge Summit, Pa.
May 10th '38.
My dear Friend:
div1.p:
I have been
thinking of you a lot for
the last few days, so
was not surprised to
receive your letter this a.m.
I am indeed sorry that
I cant tell you when
Dr Reed first owned
a microscope. But I do
know that when we
2
Vernon
reached Mount Vernon [unclear]
Barracks, after our
details in Arizona &
Neb. that the climate
was so delightful that
the call for out doors
was so great that he
soon had a flower
garden & a vegetable
garden also. I do not
believe that his work
with a microscope began
till the winter of 1890-91
He had been a long
3
time from an asso-
ciation with the scientif
ic world & it delighted
him to return to it.
I am sorry that my
information is so meagre
but it is the best I can do.
I have to smile at your
allusion to me & my
garden, for the reason
that the thermometer is 51°
this morning & it looks
like it is going to snow!
But the spring has been
the most beautiful I
have ever known & I
4
have lived in ecstacy.
My lilac's would have
won the first prize
and my rose bushes
are so vigorous & filled
with good-sized buds
My whole garden is
planted and you
fully realize the joy
I desire from it.
I have the same
gardener that I have
had for seven years
and he is so satis-
5
Blue Ridge Summit, Pa.
factory. I cant realize
what would happen
to to me if I did not
have my flowers to love
& work for.

Are with you & Mrs Kean
& Gen & Mrs Ireland
coming up to see us
this spring? we should
look for you.
Blossom was taken
6
on Easter Sunday with
flu, (intestinal) & she
after three weeks in
her room is at last
recovered. She sends
her very best love to
both of you.

Do hope you are fee-
ling well. I have been
well all winter.

Wish all good wishes
& dear love,
